titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that, as Congress observes the 40th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 and encourages all Americans to do the same, it will advance the legacy of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 by ensuring the continued effectiveness of the Act to protect the voting rights of all Americans.

Expressing the sense of the Congress that, as Congress observes the 40th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 and encourages all Americans to do the same, it will advance the legacy of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 by ensuring the continued effectiveness of the Act to protect the voting rights of all Americans.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 109-195.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 72.

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
States that Congress: (1) observes and celebrates the 40th anniversary of the enactment of the Voting Rights Act of 1965; (2) pledges to advance the legacy of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 to ensure its continued effectiveness in protecting the voting rights of all Americans; and (3) encourages all Americans to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act of 1965.
